NEW POST on WeAreTravelGirls.com by WATG Contributor Alessia Ramponi @alessia.ramponi 'A Guide To Solo Female Travel In Iran'
---------------------------------------------------
"When I was planning my trip my family and friends thought I was crazy. It was my first time in such an exotic country and it was the first time I had to cover my whole body. I didn’t know how to prepare and there was not a lot of travel information available about travelling alone as a girl in Iran. But during my 13 days spent in Iran I did meet other women traveling alone.

Many people think Iran is not a safe place to travel and even confuse Iran with Iraq. From my point of view, having spent time in the country, Iran is the best option in the Middle East for a woman to travel alone." Read the full article on WeAreTravelGirls.com
---------------------------------------------------

Can you ever tire of seeing this beautiful place in Morocco?! Gorgeous photo from Martina @theblondefootsteps⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Martina ↠ When in Marrakech, visiting the luxury hotel and spa La Mamounia is something you should do regardless of if you are planning to get a room or a treatment there. Originally being a beautiful garden given as a wedding gift to a Moroccan prince, it was remade into a hotel almost a century ago and has been declared as one of the most beautiful places in the world by, amongst others, Winston Churchill. Make sure to dress appropriately upon arrival and take your time exploring all the beauty that this place has to offer; from the garden of arrival to the different squares and rooms throughout. Finish up in the main garden going for a stroll and grabbing a coffee or some lovely Moroccan food for lunch.⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀

We Are Travel Girls Friday Favourites // Every Friday Founders @beckyvandijk and @vanessarivers share some of our favourite travel destinations, activities, travel products and travel tips with you!
______

This weeks Friday Favourite is North Bali! If you are planning a trip to Bali you should venture beyond Seminyak and Ubud up north to visit the Ulun Danu temple, some stunning waterfalls, the twin lakes, natural hot springs and of course to get a few photos in the selfie parks! A little while ago, some entrepreneurial Balinese locals started one selfie spot with a swing overlooking the lake and quickly more and more have sprung up in the same area so you can get your photo on ledges like this, on swings and even in birds nests!
If you want any more Bali tips head to WeAreTravelGirls.com where we have lots of travel articles contributed by girls in the community. @beckyvandijk
______

This community is a place we created to inspire, connect and educate female travellers and we are always looking for new ways to evolve, grow and move it in the right direction to meet that goal. You can learn more about our community on WeAreTravelGirls.com.
______

Tai Chi at the Temple of Heaven, Beijing, China. Photo by Faten Zirek @lavitaahelwa⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Beijing is a beautiful oxymore, the old beijing makes the new city even more mesmerising… The places to visit are full of culture, the city is very clean, safe and the people are amazing ! Beijing is a place I would recommend every girls to visit, especially those who would like to be famous, indeed Beijiners are real paparazzis and you feel like you’re a star :p More seriously, we stayed in the New World Beijing Hotel located in the Old Beijing and we could easily walk to the forbidden city, the hutongs, and the beautiful temple of heaven. I highly recommend it, it’s just perfect ! PS : Temples are closed on Monday, so book your Great wall visit that day !⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀

Happy New Year! ⠀⠀
We are excited to be going into 2018 with so many new plans for this community of travel loving women! We want to thank each and every one of you for your support, whether that is liking & commenting on images, hosting or joining a meet-up, coming on our first @travelgirlsgetaways, writing for the blog or interning with us, we appreciate everyone’s involvement in the community and can't wait to meet more of you in 2018!⠀⠀ ⠀⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀⠀
⠀⠀
So what happened in 2017? ⠀⠀
⠀⠀
‣ We launched @travelgirlsgetaways educational retreats, trips & tours for women - kicking off with two blogging retreats in Bali and a Photography Tour in Japan ⠀⠀
‣ We published 260 travel articles from 200 women around the world ⠀⠀
‣ We interviewed 12 inspirational women for our monthly interview series Ladies We Love ⠀⠀
‣ We featured hundreds of girls on our Instagram and introduced Traveller Tips so that the posts we share are more informative for our followers ⠀⠀
‣ We launched our YouTube channel and started a weekly vlog from Founders Becky @beckyvandijk & Vanessa @vanessarivers⠀⠀
‣ We hosted community meet-ups in London, Bali, Chicago, Los Angeles, Copenhagen, Miami and Arizona ⠀⠀
‣ We wrote an entire curriculum and 15 comprehensive eBooks to teach at our blogging retreats ⠀⠀
‣ Vanessa had a little baby daughter Sadie ⠀⠀
‣ And Becky got engaged to @ryan.roaming at the peak of Mount Batur in Bali ⠀⠀
⠀⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀⠀
⠀⠀
And What’s Next For 2018? ⠀⠀
⠀⠀
‣ Bookings open for our Bali retreats, a Malawi Safari and Charity Trip and a Morocco Country Tour in the next few weeks ⠀⠀
‣ We are expanding @travelgirlsgetaways, with lots of new destinations, including Sri Lanka, Morocco, Turkey, Iceland, a ski trip & a surf retreat⠀⠀
‣ We will launch a WATG Ambassador Programme giving you opportunities to travel and represent WATG on press trips & events around the world ⠀⠀
‣ Teach you how to pursue your dreams with blog and business mentorship programmes⠀⠀ ⠀⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀⠀
⠀⠀
Click on the link in our bio to get involved with WATG in 2018! And subscribe to our email list to receive new travel articles, ambassador travel opportunities, giveaways, new trips and special offers for getaways!

Mangup-Kale, Crimea. Photo by Alexandra Buymova @sashe4kina⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Cave City Mangup-Kale in Crimea! The word Mangup means mountain, Kale is a fortress. The complex is located on the hill Baba-Dag, which is translated from the Tatar "father-mountain". Ottomans, after the seizure of the territory and the beginning of new construction, treated the name as a "ruined fortress". If you want to visit Crimea you need to have minimum 1 month. But first - visit this place!⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today by WATG Contributor Anna Kloots @traveloutsidethebox 'Everything To Know Before Visiting Icelands Blue Lagoon'
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
A trip to Iceland wouldn't be complete without a visit to the famous blue lagoon. Located in Grindavik, 45 mins from Reykjavik the blue lagoon originates 2,000 meters below the surface and full of silica, algae and minerals giving it the milky-white colour. In Anna's post she shares some essential tips on how to make the most of the experience, including how to get there, which entry package to choose, how to protect your hair and what to bring with you. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today from WATG Contributor Cassie @CassieLeeEvans '5059M Above Sea Level & 40M Below!'
•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••
In our latest WATG contributor post, Cassie shares her experience traveling in Borneo and Malaysia. Whilst in Borneo Cassie climbed Mount Kinabalu, in what sounds like a difficult, but rewarding hike to 5059M! She then kicked back a little closer to sea level, on the beaches of the Perhentian Islands in Malaysia and spent some time exploring the beautiful underwater world! •••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today by WATG Founder Becky @beckyvandijk 'Traditional Luxury At The St Regis Singapore'
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I recently spent four amazing days exploring Singapore, staying a few nights at the luxurious St Regis hotel. Since my last trip to the country was over 12 years ago I was excited to explore, but the St Regis made it hard for me to leave the hotel! With so many amenities to enjoy, from delicious afternoon tea, to spa treatments, evening Bloody Mary tasting and my personal favourite, the art tour around the hotel I was truly spoiled during my stay! Read more on the site and to follow up I will also be sharing my Singapore highlights with you soon! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Palace of justice in Vienna, Austria // Vienna waits for you. Julie @todayshetravels⠀ 📷 by @megswanderings ⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Julie ↠ The Austrian Supreme Court is one of three judicial bodies charged with final appellate jurisdiction in the Republic of Austria. For me, it is a perfection in architecture and design, creating a magical feeling, when entering this hall. Vienna named world’s top city for quality of life, several times. As a Vienna born child, it’s amazing to see the city from a visitor’s eye, cause when you walk around Vienna, you can almost feel the footsteps of Mozart, Beethoven, Haydn, or Schubert. The German name for Vienna is Wien. So yes, that means Austria’s most famous dish, the wiener schnitzel, translates to Viennese schnitzel 👏🏻 PS: around the corner of the justice hall, there are a lot more architectural highlights to see.⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀

Wandering the Valleys of Cappadocia, Turkey. Photo by Daniella @daniellas.travels⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Cappadocia is a must-see for everyone within their lifetime. Everywhere you look is totally post-card perfect, it's hard to believe it is real. My traveller tip would be to rent a scooter and get lost in it's hidden valleys. It's the cheapest and coolest (literally) way to explore the area as you get that breeze to cool you from the turkish heat as well as being able to command your own itinerary!⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀

JODHPUR, RAJASTHAN // We love to explore the colourful buildings of Jodhpur through the eyes of Sindhya @whyweseek ⠀
✧✧✧✧✧
⠀
Traveller Tip From Sindhya ↠ Wandering around Jodhpur is a must on any visit to Rajasthan! It’s nicknamed the “Blue City” because historically homes were painted blue to signify that a Brahmin (Hindu priest) lived there. It’s now become what the city is famous for, many people still paint their homes blue because it keeps houses cool during the long hot summers. This makes it a really unique and colorful destination for travel photographers. Add the busy bazaars, Mehrangarh Fort, plus a visit to the Jaswant Thada, and there’s plenty to keep you busy. Don’t forget to include this city on your India itinerary!⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧
⠀

Wat Pha Sohn Kaew, Thailand. Photo by Lola Hubner @lolahubner⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ This temple was one of the most unique and beautiful I have ever seen. Deep in northern Thailand lays Wat Pha Sohn Kaew and if you're lucky enough to visit you won't be disappointed! This temple is covered in gold walkways and is full of hand painted walls that easily will take your breath away. It is harder to get to but it's worth the trip, I was lucky enough to have a family member drive me but there are plenty of tour buses that can drop you off! Be sure to walk around the whole complex because every inch is amazing⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀

GIZA, EGYPT // Walking like an egyptian with Chandee @chandee_thorburn⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Chandee ↠ I have always found ancient Egyptian history so fascinating and it has been my dream to visit the pyramids since I was a child. And who can blame me — they are the only remaining Ancient Wonder of the World built over 4,000 years ago! ⠀
⠀
I have put off visiting Egypt for the last five years because everyone told me it ‘wasn’t safe’ to go there alone. I ended up going alone anyway, because I knew that if I didn’t, then I’d probably never end up going. I received a number of mixed reactions when I told people I was going there solo. Most of them believed I was digging my own grave. If you appreciate history, culture and great energy, then you will find the city of Cairo to be very beautiful. I found the local people to be very caring and friendly. My tour guide Samir treated me like I was his daughter and made me feel at home. ⠀
⠀
The pyramids are very easily accessible however I strongly recommend hiring a private tour guide, it’ll make everything so much easier. At no point in my trip did I feel unsafe. That being said, you should always take precautions wherever you go. I stayed at Mena House Hotel. It is located right next to the pyramids (you have stunning views of the pyramids from the hotel) and the grounds feature beautiful outdoor pools and gardens. The staff were wonderful, I highly recommend staying here.⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀

HAPPY INTERNATIONAL WOMENS DAY! ⠀
⠀
We created this community a couple of years ago to celebrate women who were inspiring us with their travels around the world. We shared their photos here and shared their travel stories on WeAreTravelGirls.com.⠀
⠀
As well as everything we do to bring you together online, what we love most is creating a place for you to make in person connections at our events and @travelgirlsgetaways. We are always amazed by the women we meet, their personal stories, their love for travel, their entrepreneurial journeys, how they support one another and lift each other up instead of pulling one another down. Thats what keeps us working hard to grow and manage this community which we hope you all love to be part of! Instagram is a strange world, but remember its also the place that has brought many of us together and today lets not compare ourselves or compete with one another lets lift each other up! ⠀
⠀
So for international women's day we would love for you to share with us a woman who has inspired you that you want to celebrate and show some love - whether its someone you know, a friend, a family member, an online connection or even a celebrity, writer, actress, activist - whoever it is we want you to share who they are and why they inspire you in the comments below! We will shout out some of our favourites in our stories today!⠀
⠀
Thank you to everyone who has contributed to the community over the years even if thats simply by liking one of the pictures we share or reading a blog post. And thank you especially to the women who have helped us by volunteering their time and being part of the team over the last two years, @shannonboselli @kaymurz @leahlabelle @annysadventures @luluescapes @haddyinharmony and the one guy who makes sure our website works everyday @ryan.roaming!⠀
⠀
And finally a shout out to ourselves, the women behind this community @beckyvandijk and @vanessarivers. We are often so busy and stressed with all the work that we don't step back and celebrate what we have created! The 15hr work days tire us out, but seeing real friendships created from the community inspires us everyday to continue and make WATG bigger and better!

Everyone will take away a different experience from any travel they do. For me, I value the global friendships that travel can bring you.
A few years ago I was lucky enough to meet an awesome Australian girl @julieannekeane in Costa Rica and 5 years later we met up in Finland to stay in a glass igloo! Now I have another two new friends and we are planning to start meeting up every year at a different Ice Hotel, next stop Quebec!! The great thing is no matter how much time passes you can pick up where you left off and we had the best girls weekend running around Lapland!
Tag your global friends who you would sleep under the stars in an igloo with!!
@julieannekeane @rachelagars @melly_millen @beckyvandijk

ISTANBUL, TURKEY // Images like this don't even need a caption. Beautiful photo from Viktoriya @tiebowtie ⠀
______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // Sultan Ahmed Mosque, popularly known as The Blue Mosque is located in Istanbul. The mosque was constructed between 1609 and 1616 during the rule of Ahmed I. Inside, its Külliye contains Ahmed's tomb, a madrasah and a hospice. Hand-painted blue tiles decorate the mosque’s interior walls, and at night the mosque comes alive when its bathed in blue as lights frame the mosque’s five main domes, six minarets and eight secondary domes. ⠀
⠀
The mosque sits next to Hagia Sophia, making it easy to visit both sites together, but remember the mosque is used for worship so you will need to plan your visit around prayer times. Mid-morning is a great time to visit, but expect to queue as this is a popular tourist spot. ⠀
______⠀
⠀

______⠀
⠀
"Before traveling to Pakistan I didn’t know what to expect as I didn’t find any useful travel information to prepare my trip. However, after 20 days traveling in Pakistan, I can say it is one of my favorite countries in the world. Pakistan is the land of hospitality and you will find the kindest people you will ever meet. The security situation in Pakistan is totally fine. I never faced any issue and every time I needed some help with language or directions I always found someone willing to help me. If you like landscapes, nature, culture, architecture and delicious food, Pakistan will be the perfect place for you."⠀

SCOTLAND // Did you know that fairytales actually exist?! Well apparently they do and they are located in Scotland! One of our fave travel girls Anna @ananewyork making her own princess dreams come true! ⠀

⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // Craigievar castle is said to be the inspiration for Walt Disney's famous Cinderella castle and is just one of over 2,000 castles in Scotland. The castle lies 26 miles west of Aberdeen and can easily be added to a road trip through this part of the country. The best thing about Scotland is that it is beautiful throughout the year, especially in the winter! So start planning your trip now. ⠀

Santorini secrets. Photo by Ayda Izadpanah @us.on.earth⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Did you know that Santorini is basically the remains of a massive volcanic eruption? Sadly, it destroyed the early settlements of what used to be a single island. Today, it seems to be the most popular island in Greece. Thousands flock to watch one of the most breathtaking sunsets in the world. Finding your own view spot can be very challenging, but so worth the effort when discovered. I suggest scouting the spot early then showing up an hour before the sun sets.⠀
⠀

PORTUGAL // A castle in the clouds at Palacio Nacional de Pena or the Pena Palace captured by @jacimariesmith⠀
______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // The Palacio Nacional de Pena is situated in the picturesque Portuguese town of Sintra and easily reached on a day trip from Lisbon. Sitting at the top of a hill in the Sintra mountains the palace offers stunning vistas out over the city, and on a clear day you can even see it from Lisbon. If you want to spend more time in Sintra, there are plenty of other sites to explore such as the historic town centre and the Castelo dos Mouros. But you should be sure to end you day at the Pena Palace to enjoy the sunset!⠀

We Are Travel Girls Friday Favourites // Every Friday Founders @beckyvandijk and @vanessarivers share some of our favourite travel destinations, activities, travel products and travel tips with you!⠀
______⠀
⠀
This weeks Friday Favorite is Thean Hou Temple in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. This temple is not on every tourist list for visitors to KL, meaning you will be able to visit this beautiful place of worship with few other other people around. ⠀
⠀
The temple is one of the oldest and largest in Asia built in 1894, and was dedicated to Tian Hou, a goddess said to protect fishermen. Set on a hill, the temple offers stunning views back out over the city - giving you a unique mix of the modern city married with a traditional buddhist temple. It's a beautiful place to visit both during the day and the night when it is all lit up and I highly recommend adding it to your schedule when you visit the city. ⠀
⠀
☆ Note, I did not have the temple on my itinerary on the day that I went so was not wearing long trousers or skirt. However, the dress code at Thean Hou is relaxed, and tourists are permitted to visit in shorts. But I do advise always checking dress codes in advance and wearing respectful clothing
______⠀
⠀

⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Most would expect the Sahara to be scorching hot, but that wasn't the case. We were there beginning of November it was cool enough for me to be able to take off my sweater for this photo, but after sundown it was a completely different story. At the camp site they had the thickest blankets you could imagine, but it was still freezing. We hear during the month of December, it is a whole different ball game! So be prepared with thick socks and layers of clothing.⠀

BALI // Imagine 13 girls exploring the island of Bali together, learning new skills, eating delicious food, making lasting friendships and laughing for 7 days straight - well that was our first We Are Travel Girls Bali Retreat last week! Hosted by founders @beckyvandijk and @vanessarivers we had an incredible group of women from all backgrounds join us for what turned out to be the trip of a lifetime. ⠀
Our retreats and trips are an inclusive place for women of all backgrounds looking to travel with other women, explore a new destination, learn from one another and to develop themselves. Amongst this group we had a pilot, an app developer, a freelance digital marketer, a department of defence lawyer, a luxury concierge and a private chef and many more, so its safe to say we had a group of incredibly intelligent women who were passionate about travel and driven to move their own business forward and pursue their dreams! ⠀

Thanks to @shireen_gupta @faustinehug @happily_thirtysomething @walkwithrich @wanderlustprima @amandatwine @ttoriwashere @jloomisss @lemaytwins @atravelistasguide @laiyolan for making this week so special! 😘

______⠀
⠀
We cannot wait to welcome more women from this community to our trips in 2018 and you can join us as we head back to Bali and several other destinations for retreats, trips and tours next year! We have different trip formats available, some are active outdoor trips, some charitable, some have a focus on learning blogging and photography and others are a mix of these. ⠀
⠀
Head over to WeAreTravelGirls.com/Travel-With-Us/ to learn more and express interest in joining a future trip so that you will be first to know when bookings open! And follow along on our stories and @travelgirlsgetaways as we start the next Bali retreat tomorrow! ✈️
______⠀
⠀

SPAIN // Did you know about the giant sequoias that can be found in Spain?! These beautiful trees were planted in Cantabria in the 1940s as part of a plantation experiment and were never cut down! Photo by Lisa @leeses⠀
______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // The Cantabria region in Northern Spain offers visitors a unique combination of landscapes, a breathtaking coast line, alongside deep valleys and stunning mountain ranges. There are pretty seaside towns to explore, plenty of historical attractions, numerous hiking trails and many warm and cold weather activities to indulge the thrill seeking traveller. But despite the many things to do in this region, Cantabria remains relatively undeveloped compared to the rest of the country. Go and discover this part of Spain before everyone else does!⠀
⠀

Feature Tip No. 3 ~ Be a great travel diary!
As much as we love the fashion blogs and your personal day to day accounts, our followers look to us to find great new travel accounts they haven't seen before, so we endeavour to feature images from accounts that are largely travel related.
It doesn't have to be overseas it can be hometown travel, it's just that we are less likely to feature an image if it's just one image from a recent holiday amongst a page of selfies! 😬 We do love those accounts too and sometimes make exceptions for an awesome shot! 😉💕

Traveller Tip ↠ The Paris Opera was founded in 1662 by Louis XIV. It is the primary opera company of France, and is one of the most famous in the world! The annual budget to maintain this place is about 200 million euros. To witness this magnificent building without the tour group crowds, be there as soon as they open or wait until the last moment before they close to get that shot. Even then, you must be patient!⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com by WATG Contributor Mariana Soares de Oliveira Gentile @mari_travelstheworld '5 reasons why you have to visit the Namib Desert'

_______
The Namibian desert was the most unique place I have ever been. The landscapes are gorgeous and under the impression that you are in the middle of nowhere. The country is HUGE and has several great choices: safari in the Etosha Park in the north, the famous Skeleton Coast and the Namib-Naukluft Park in the south are the main ones. Since we only had 6 days off we had to focus on one region only, and I do not regret our choice for one second.

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today from WATG Founder Becky @beckyvandijk 'Relais Christine: Parisian Luxury Set In The Latin Quarter'
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Built on the remains of the Abbey of the Grands-Augustins, which was founded in 1231, the Relais Christine hotel combines the authenticity of a traditional Parisian mansion with all the modern amenities you would expect to find in a luxury hotel. As soon as you walk through the iron gates into the pretty courtyard, you feel as if you have stepped into a country home rather than a hotel making this the perfect place for your next trip to Paris! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Two years ago this January Vanessa and I met up to talk about We Are Travel Girls. I had recently started this Instagram page and the community was growing quickly so we decided to come together to take the community beyond just this online platform. ⠀
⠀
We have done lots of things in those two years to grow WATG, but one thing we are still striving to achieve is a decent photo together... inevitably most times we fail because we get distracted by pineapples and always end up taking only photos of us putting them on our heads! Now the pineapples in this photo were so tiny you can hardly see them, but if you have followed us for a while you will have probably seen us do this before! (And I am sure you will see it again!) ⠀
⠀
Whilst our Instagram page shows adventurous women looking wonderful all over the globe, remember when you are taking photos to enjoy yourself, don’t take it too seriously and be silly - and hopefully at the same time you will capture some magical moments with friends! ⠀
⠀
@beckyvandijk @vanessarivers ⠀

LA FORTUNA WATERFALL, COSTA RICA // Chasing waterfalls with Lauren Cude @adventure_seeker28 in Costa Rica! ⠀
______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP by Lauren // Last year I visited Costa Rica for the first time, and it instantly stole my heart. One place in particular was La Fortuna Waterfall. Usually you can swim in the pool where the waterfall runs into, but due to heavy rain recently there the water was too rough. Still made for a great view to get close and enjoy the beautiful views. If you are able to visit Costa Rica, make sure to stop by this waterfall. It is a hike down, but so worth it. Plus if you turn around from this view the river goes on for a while and has plenty of places to sunbathe and explore even more gorgeous views.⠀
______⠀
⠀

Mornings in Morocco at Agafay Desert. Photo by Daniella @daniellas.travels⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ When visiting Marrakech, most people hope to visit the Sahara Desert. However, with a 14 hour return journey, this is sometimes not feasible, especially if you are on a short trip! However, only 45 minutes away is the lesser known Agafay Desert. This Stone Desert features some beautiful camps which you can spend the day in or even an overnight trip. My top recommendation would be @scarabeocamp, which is visually stunning and the perfect way to relax after the hustle and bustle of the Marrakech Medina!⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀

ABU DHABI // The stunning Sheikh Zayed Mosque in Abu Dhabi captured by @lale.d⠀
______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // Even if you are not staying in Abu Dhabi you can still visit the mosque from Dubai. The journey is 150km and takes around 1.5hrs by taxi and costs roughly USD 75 each way. But once you arrive it is free to enter and also free to borrow an Abaya to wear during your visit. If you can get up early in the morning you will avoid the midday heat, but if you prefer to capture to beautiful light as the sun goes down head there a little later in the day. ⠀
⠀

Traveller Tip From Anika ↠ The Keukenhoff is a famous tulip garden in the Netherlands, close to Amsterdam. However, even more beautiful are the surrounding fields in the area where you rent bikes and cycle around. This shot was taken in Lisse in April of 2017. The best time to catch the fields are the second week of April to the first week of May. The cut the flower heads off after this time so get there between then!⠀

______
We Are Travel Girls was created 18 months ago by @beckyvandijk and @vanessarivers. When we started we simply wanted to provide a platform to promote other women and share their travel stories on WeAreTravelGirls.com. But as we grew our ideas, the community grew with us and WATG has become so much more than our original vision. With a huge amount of hard work (don't believe the photos we post, we spend 95% of our time behind a laptop screen!) and your support we have created a company that now inspires your travel on Instagram, connects you in our Facebook group, brings women together offline at meet-ups, publishes 5 travel stories per week from members of the community and has recently launched @travelgirlsgetaways where we can travel together!
Thank you to everyone who supports this community and helps it to grow everyday. We really appreciate you all and hope you enjoy the full video shot by talented videographer Iris @crafted_films 🎥
Becky & Vanessa 😘
______
As founders we continue to think bigger and are always looking for feedback on what we are doing and what we can do better to build a community that YOU love! Make sure you are up to date with everything we are doing and how you can get involved by subscribing to our email list. Here we share travel inspiration from women in the community, information about our events and trips and also will soon be sharing opportunities to be an ambassador for WATG to attend events and press trips with us!

Just floating In The Dead Sea. Photo by Julia Rosenbusch @ju.hu.lia⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ The Dead Sea is a salt lake bordered by Jordan to the east and Israel and Palestine to the west. Its surface and shores are 430.5 metres below sea level - lowest point on earth. The Dead Sea is the deepest hypersaline lake in the world. With a salinity of 34.2%. What an incedible feeling to float in it and we had so much fun!⠀

ANNECY, FRANCE // Thank you to the gorgeous Pippa Marffy @wander_pip for sharing this fairytale shot and her travel tips for Annecy with us. ⠀
______⠀ ⠀

TRAVELLER TIP // Sometimes called the ‘Venice of the Alps’, the medieval town of Annecy straddles a series of winding canals at the northern tip of Lake Annecy. With a criss-cross of bridges, abundant colourful flower boxes, cobblestone streets and houses painted in delicious pastel hues, Annecy is postcard perfect. You could easily spend a day just meandering through the old streets of Annecy; people watching, drinking coffee and sampling french pastries. However, I would really recommend hiring bikes or a car to drive around the lake. There are plenty of cute villages to explore, rolling farm hills with stunning views, and even a handful of beautiful old castles to visit!⠀

HOLBOX, MEXICO // Swinging into 2018 with Lucie Ondreasz @global_mimi . Wheres next on your bucketlist?⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Lucie ↠ Mexico is always deemed as highly unsafe for travellers, let alone female solo travellers. Of course there are places and situations to steer clear of but that is the same in most countries. If you are looking for a solo travel destination then look no further than the Yucatan and Quintana Roo regions of Mexico. Isla Holbox is one of the safest places I have ever been alone and is the perfect place to start your adventure and to ease yourself in to a solo adventure.⠀
⠀

Winter wonderland in Lapland. Photo of Ana Silva @anamafalda8 by Renato Ferreira @renato.df⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Notes ↠ Lapland has been a dream come true! Between the northern lights, the landscapes, the crazy sunsets that almost felt like they where touching the snow, and the endless roads.... I did not feel the cold anymore! I was so amazed it almost felt like a dream, a dream that everyone once in their lives should be able to be apart of. And I definitely would recommend a road trip to explore everything Lapland has to offer, and of course, pay a visit to Santa (if you have been a good girl!) and to his reindeers and huskies!
We have a 4 day Lapland itinerary up on WeAreTravelGirls.com for any of you planning a trip to this part of the world! ⠀

Feature Tip No. 2 ~ Tag us in your pic!
Another obvious one, but in addition to using the hashtag, tag us in your images! A little piece of advice, if you tag an old picture from your feed, the tagged picture will show by date and be buried under the many more recent photos tagged to our account, so aim to tag your latest images so they appear at the top. If it's an older image and you want to make sure it's noticed DM it over to me!

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today from WATG Founder @BeckyvanDijk 'Summerlove Swimwear - Bikini Giveaway!'
•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••
Ahead of our @SummerloveSwimwear 100k Bestie Bikini Giveaway I wanted to share some more information about the story behind these gorgeous Eco bikinis designed by We Are Travel Girls co-founder @VanessaRivers. Summerlove bikinis are manufactured in California and made with @econylbrand, a 100% recycled polyamide fiber that’s made from pre and post-consumer materials such as discarded fishing nets recovered by the Healthy Seas Initiative. Hands up if you want to go to Sri Lanka! I am currently visiting the country doing some research for a future @travelgirlsgetaways retreat. Sri Lanka has surprised me in so many ways already - it still retains an old world charm and has not yet been made too touristic, there are so many beaches where you will walk miles and not see another person, the surfing is great, it feels like when I backpacked through Asia the first time 15 years ago and above all that the people are absolutely lovely and so kind. I still have another week to explore and know it won’t be enough so I cannot wait to come back - and we want you to come here with us! ⠀⠀
⠀⠀
You can express interest in joining us in Sri Lanka or another destination or book your place on our Bali Retreats in October and our Malawi Safari & Charity Trip in September. Head to https://Getaways.WeAreTravelGirls.com for more information. Link in our bio. ⠀⠀
⠀⠀
(P.s. Train travel in Sri Lanka is one of the main ways to get around and since trains are relatively infrequent many locals actually walk along the track. This one was right outside where we stayed at The Muse @taruvillas in Bentota, and the trains only passed every few hours - so don’t try and repeat this picture elsewhere!)⠀⠀

Stand up paddling in the glacier at Hintertuxer Gletscher. Photo by Jana Bogena @alohaa_jana⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ The Hintertuxer Glacier is a fantastic skiing destination for beginners and advanced Skiers. The amazing view at the top most point (ca. 3200 meters), which you can reach with gondola 3, is just breathtaking. But a lot of people don't know anything about the natural ice palace up at the top. Its an incredible glacier that you are able to go inside and explore to see amazing ice formations. Also, if you want to do something unique ask about stand up paddling in the glacier lake that formed on the inside. It’s an incredible experience. I can really recommend it. Ask for Paul as a guide, he was so helpful and knows everything about the glacier.⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀

But more importantly that we would have been able to make so many personal connections with women around the world through this platform.
We want to say a huge thank you to each and every one of you who has been part of this community in any way, whether that's sharing a photo with us, contributing a travel article, attending a meet-up, helping plan some of our upcoming meet-ups, or simply liking a picture we feature!
Every connection is important to us and we look forward to making more throughout 2017. You are this community, and we created it for you! So whilst we have some exciting things lined up for this year, we welcome feedback, suggestions and to hear what you want to see more of from WATG!
Thank you everyone,

An Enchanting Walk in the Porto Cathedral. Photo by Jiayi Wang @thediaryofanomad
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ The fascinating Sé do Porto (Porto Cathedral) is influenced by three architecture styles: Romanesque, Gothic, and Baroque. While the building looks Romanesque from the outside, its interiors are adorned with Gothic cloisters and Baroque ceramic tiles (azulejos) that beautifully illustrate Portuguese history, culture, and religion. In front of this cathedral, there’s a large square that not only offers gorgeous views over the city, but also connects to some lovely narrow alleys that eventually lead you to the Ribeira. There, you can find numerous restaurants and cafes with magical views of the Douro River and the pretty little houses that surround it. If you do plan to visit Porto, make sure to also check out Aveiro, an intriguingly colourful seaside town that’s only an hour away.⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀

SANTORINI // The magnificent views and colours of Santorini captured perfectly by Verena @topolindra⠀
______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // Whilst visiting many destinations during the off-season is a great way to escape the crowds it is recommended to visit Santorini during the peak months of June to September. Outside of this time the island can be cold and windy. But if you are planning a trip for 2018, take a look into some activities away from the beaches, such as the Museum of Prehistoric Thira, where you can view artefacts found in the ruins of Akrotiri or wine tasting at one of Santorini's vineyards, including Argiros Estate, Santo Wines, Roussos Winery and Boutari Winery. Please share your own tips for the island in the comments!⠀
______⠀
⠀

HOUSTON, TEXAS // As you will have seen in the news many residents of Texas have been hit by devastating Tropical Storm Harvey. The storm caused massive flooding throughout southern Texas, displacing many families and residents and there are more rains expected.
Travel girls member and Houston native Andrea @fofiecake reached out to us to lend support and send love to those affected in the region.
______
We wanted to share a few ways that you can help support. Donations can be made to the following organisations:
American Red Cross - redcross.org/hp/harvey2/ @americanredcross
All Hands - hands.org/texas-hurricane-response/ @allhandsvolunteers
Global Giving - globalgiving.org/projects/hurricane-harvey-relief-fund/ @globalgiving

Houston Humane Society - sahumane.org @houstonhumane
Plus there are many more organisations that are helping, so please do your own research on which organisations to donate to.
Thank you for your support 💛

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today from WATG Founder Becky @beckyvandijk 'Food, History & An Epic View At L'Oiseau Blanc'
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Since I come from an aviation family, (my grandfather and father were both pilots and my mother an air stewardess), I was pretty excited to visit L'Oiseau Blanc in Paris. The restaurant is dedicated to Charles Nungesser and Francois Coli who mysteriously disappeared during an attempt at the first non-stop Atlantic crossing from Paris to New York in 1927. This stunning restaurant is designed with every detail an ode to French aviation history, whilst offering amazing food and an impressive view of the Eiffel Tower! @peninsulahotels @thepeninsulaparis
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

MUIZENBERG, CAPE TOWN // Cindy @cindyycheeks exploring one of Cape Towns most colourful spots ⠀⠀⠀
______⠀⠀⠀
⠀⠀⠀
Traveller Tip From Cindy ↠ Muizenberg is a beach-side suburb of Cape Town, South Africa. It’s believed to be the birthplace of surfing in South Africa. Today, you’ll still find a ton of wind surfers gliding in the cold Atlantic water, along with these picturesque and colorful beach huts. They’re perfect for a photo op, but be sure to bring warm clothes, Cape Town can get pretty windy. You can’t tell but I was actually freezing and I was ready to throw on my jacket immediately after the photo was taken!⠀⠀⠀
______⠀⠀⠀
⠀⠀⠀

Madurai Palace, India. Photo by Anoushka Probyn @anoushkalila⠀⠀
⠀⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀⠀
⠀⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ The town of Madurai in Tamil Nadu, South India, is rarely on the itinerary of tourists compared to the well-trodden routes of the North. However i’ve been visiting since I was a child as my mother’s family are from here, so much so that it’s become a second home. As such I’ve discovered how much soul this small but buzzy town has, from the bold multi-coloured houses that line the streets to the lively children keen to have a chat and test their English. It also has architecture to rival the sights of the North, with the breathtaking Meenakshi Temple presiding over the town (historically no one was allowed to build any building taller than the temple towers), as well as the beautiful 17th century Thirumalai Nayak Palace. Whilst South India might not be the most obvious travel destination, it definitely has a few hidden gems worth making the trip!⠀⠀
⠀⠀

⠀⠀
Traveller Tip From Becky ↠ There is just one main tip needed for visiting Fushimi Inari Shrine and that is to arrive early! We woke up before sunrise and made sure that we were at the shrine before 6am when the sunrises. Check the exact sunrise time when you are visiting and make sure to plan accordingly. By getting there early you will be able to take some photos without other tourists in them and enjoy exploring the complex without a tonne of people around. Make sure to go beyond the first gates and keep walking to find more trails of tori gates and plenty of opportunities to capture some wonderful shots. ⠀⠀
Wearing sunglasses by @kaptenandson⠀⠀

______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // Emerald Lake, known for its shockingly aqua water color, is located in Yoho National Park in Alberta, Canada. At over 2,000 meters from sea level, this glacially fed lake is cold year round. Hikers can experience views from all over the lake, but be sure to come prepared with sunscreen, water, snacks, and bug repellent - even in the winter!⠀

HAPPY INTERNATIONAL WOMENS DAY FROM US TO YOU!⠀
⠀
Today we are celebrating International Women's Day with Worldpackers because they are as passionate about building an equal and sustainable future for women as we are. ⠀
⠀
Did you know 81% of women have faced challenges related to their gender during their travels and 67% of women are afraid to travel alone?⠀
⠀
As we fight for equality, we continue to fight for a change in these numbers. Our goal is to send this message of inspiration to every corner of the globe, to encourage women to feel empowered and inspired. Our message is clear - a woman's place is where a woman wants to go and where she chooses to identify herself. As women we are able to travel alone and find support in communities like ours, we overcome challenges together and we continue our fight for equality. ⠀
⠀
We can travel alone, we can travel together and we can help communities to forge a sustainable future together. Join us by supporting and joining the @Worldpackers community this women's day to find your next life changing experience!⠀
⠀
Head to our stories to see a preview of Worldpackers video uniting inspirational women around the world. And click on the link in our bio to see the full version!⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀

A night in the desert. Photo by Ophelie Moris-Guichard @labengale⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Sleeping in the desert is one of my best experiences to date! If you decide to go, I recommend you to stay 2 days, try sand boarding, ride a camel and enjoy the sunrise and the sunset. You can also make a tour with a 4x4, meet the bedouin people and eat some good meals. I advise you to rent a car from Marrakech and make a break in Ait Ben Haddou to arrive in the desert the next day. To go back to Marrakech, make a break in the beautiful Tinghir. You won't be disappointed! That's the best experience I had during my travels.⠀
⠀

Jeonju, South Korea // The beauty of South Korea by Eunji Noh @ej_noh ⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Eunji Noh ↠ Jeonju is one of the most beautiful and traditional cities in South Korea. Located in the center of the city is a "Hanok village" which showcases traditional Korean housing. Additionally, visitors can rent a hanbok, a traditional type of Korean outfit, to wear as they explore the village and surrounding neighborhoods. It's a great opportunity to feel a bit of old Korea and take some amazing pictures at the same time. And maybe best of all, there is tons of street food to munch on as you enjoy your day!⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com by WATG Co-Founder Vanessa Rivers @vanessarivers '8 Tips For Traveling With A Baby'⠀
______⠀
⠀
As a new mom so I can say from experience that traveling with a baby can be very challenging. My baby girl has two passports (British and US) and has visited three countries at just six-months-old. It sounds cool to be a travel mom but in reality it is like being an unpaid sherpa. Gone are the days when you can throw a few things in an overnight bag and just go somewhere (at least when traveling with your family). ⠀
⠀
Family travel, especially with a baby, requires planning. I have managed to take a few trips without my daughter in the last few months, but the traveling I have done with her, while challenging, has also been very rewarding. If you are a new parent here are 8 tips for traveling with a baby.⠀
⠀

Traveller Tip ↠ My love for Indian stepwells brought me to a village in Amer, near Jaipur, to visit Panna Meena ka Kund. This heritage place was constructed in the 16 th century. It was intended to conserve as much water as possible during the monsoon season and was used for community gathering during intense heat. This stepwell is just next to Amber fort, but I was surprised to see that only a handful of tourists knows about this delightful sight.⠀

Hi girls! We have a special request from one of our followers @shaylyn.marie to help her win her dream trip to Tanzania with @passionpassport.
Check out the link in our bio where you can read Shaylyn's application and vote for her to win! It only takes a minute, so please take the time to help one of our fellow travel girls so we can all share in her journey to Africa if she wins!
Asked why she wanted to take this trip, Shaylyn explained - ''One of the first books I asked my father to read to me was Origins. I was six. In this book, R. Leakey takes his readers on a journey through the lands of Africa. Intrigued by the human-like skull and the Serengeti plains on the cover, I insisted my father purchase it from the local thrift store. It is still signed by a George who owned the book decades before. It was at this time that my fascination of Africa began. In May I will graduate with my BA in Anthropology. Amazingly my childhood fascination withstood the test of time and is as intense in my adulthood as it was then. To explore the lands I found so novel in this book would make real for me a very intimate, special passion; a passion to bring to life these lands of antiquity through photography and storytelling. Years of exposure to National Geographic photos, documentaries, expeditions, and four years of intense study have only amplified my dreams of exploring Tanzania. I am ready to live, breathe, and share this adventure.''

Traveller Tip ↠ The Red Lotus Sea is a romantic getaway in Thailand – and yet undiscovered by western tourists. It is actually a lake filled with red lotus flowers that bloom between December and mid February. It makes for a perfect Valentine-holiday with your loved one. Sunrise in Cappadocia. Photo of Lucia Tranos @lucyinthesskyy by Angelo Ilio @angelo_ilio⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Cappadokia is a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Central Turkey known for its "fairy chimney" landscape. It is highly recommended to experience a hot air balloon ride to have an aerial view of these unique cone rock formations! Also, do not miss out of the sunrise views with the hot air balloons from a distance which is an absolute dream! Best way to reach Cappadokia is via airway from Istanbul either from Kayseri airport or Nevsehir Airport and then about 1 hour car ride. There are limited public transportation options within Cappadokia so it is easier to get around by either renting a car and exploring the region by yourself or by booking a tour.⠀
⠀

Awesome capture by Kristina @hobopeeba at Lake Baikal in Russia. Located in Southern Siberia, Lake Baikal is the largest fresh water lake by volume in the world. MARAS, PERU // Some like coy ponds, we prefer salt ponds. Captured by Stevo and Chanel @howfarfromhome⠀
______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // Located 40 kilometers north of the famous Peruvian city of Cusco, Maras a city located in a canyon filled with geometric salt pools cultivated since the Incan empire. Today there are about 3,000 pools fed by a small stream that are cultivated, bagged, packaged, and sold at market by the local community. The most popular way to reach the town is with a tour company, which leaves many times a day from Cusco. ⠀

ICELAND // The DC-4 Plane Wreckage captured by traveler and videographer Katherine @katherine_wanders
______⠀
⠀
Back in 1973, this Navy plane ran out of fuel and crashed on the desolate black sand beach at Sólheimasandur, on the Southern coast of Iceland. Thankfully, everyone on the plane survived the crash. Over four decades later, the abandoned aircraft makes for one of the most hauntingly beautiful photography locations. ⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // You’ll walk about 4km to get to the aircraft, and you won’t be able to see it until the very end because it is hidden by a sand dune. GPS Coordinates: 63.459523,-19.364618⠀
______⠀
⠀

Whilst traveling to foreign countries many of us have faced hardships, missing a flight or losing a passport, but last year Jai @jaimeeratliff faced a challenge that could have stopped her travelling altogether.
Whilst traveling in South America she and a friend were held at gun point on a bus and robbed of everything they owned. After this experience they travelled back to the US contemplating how lucky they were to leave with their lives. Recently Jai took her first solo trip to Ireland to regain her love for adventure and travel and we are so glad she did as her page is beautiful!! We certainly don't want to shine a light on any countries being un-safe to travel and in fact having spent six months travelling through South America myself I fortunately never once felt threatened and have personally had more incidents of robbery walking home in Notting Hill, London!
The main point is that whilst sadly these events can happen abroad, they can also happen close to home, don't allow fear (or the media) to stop you from seeing the world and experiencing beautiful places and cultures, but be cautious when doing so.
Have a lovely day travel girls wherever you are in the world! 😘

NINH BINH, VIETNAM // Another stunning photo from Kelsey @milesofsmiles._ exploring Vietnam⠀
______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER INFORMATION // The Bích Động Pagoda is a series of three temples built into the cliff side that are over 500 years old. The pagoda is a popular tourist destination in northern Vietnam and part of the Tràng An Scenic Landscape Complex UNESCO World Heritage site. ⠀
⠀
The pagoda is located in Ninh Binh province, near the village of Tam Cốc. It consists of two distinct attractions: Tam Cốc, a flooded cave karst system and Bích Động, a series of mountain pagodas.⠀
⠀
Tam Cốc, literally meaning "three caves", consists of three natural caves — Hang Cả, Hang Hai, and Hang Ba all situated on the Ngô Đồng River. Tourists are taken on a scenic journey in small boats along the river from the village of Van Lam, through rice fields and limestone karsts, through the caves, and back. ⠀
⠀
______⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today by WATG Founders @beckyvandijk and @vanessarivers sharing '12 Reasons To Join The We Are Travel Girls Bali Retreat!'
_____
Life is short and the world is wide. With so many places to see on this planet, so many types of trips to take, and so many options for retreats to join it can be hard to decide which to choose. But some opportunities come along in life that are just too good to pass up, and as the founders of We Are Travel Girls we can honestly say that joining our We Are Travel Girls Bali Retreat is one of them! 💗
We are putting our whole hearts into making this a trip of a lifetime, because for us running these retreats is not just a job, it’s a chance to connect with other like-minded travel girls, it’s a chance to inspire other women to follow their dreams and accomplish their goals, and its an opportunity to create a seven-day adventure that becomes the best week of our lives! 🌴🙋🏼
We want to encourage you to join us for this amazing week in paradise so we created this list of 12 reasons to book your place on our We Are Travel Girls Bali Retreat! ✈️

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today from Co-Founder Vanessa @vanessarivers 'Visiting The White Temple In Thailand'
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
The White Temple, called Wat Rong Khun, is a privately owned Buddhist temple and art exhibit in Chiang Rai. Chalermchai Kositpipat, a local artist, used his own money to build the temple and says the entire project will not be completed until 2070. But as it sits now, the White Temple is very impressive and worth a visit if you are going to be near Chiang Rai. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

A Gray Morning at Cathedral Cove, New Zealand. Photo by Viktoria Steinhaus @viktoriawanders⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ New Zealand is full of awe and wonder and the Coromandel Peninsula on the North Island is no exception. Endless, jagged coastlines alongside dense rainforest makes this a special destination for locals and visitors. Wind through a mix of woodlands and coastal views to arrive at Cathedral Cove, an impressive rock arched way that leads to this towering sea stack. Although sunrise was nonexistent that morning, the moody sky and ocean midst made it feel magical, strolling through the golden sand without a soul in sight.⠀

THE ALHAMBRA // We are excited to share that our founder @beckyvandijk has created a unique Spanish trip itinerary in collaboration with the awesome travel site @travel__honey. TRAVELLER TIP // Book your tickets for the Alhambra early to avoid disappointment! The first time I tried to visit I was not able to as you need to book about a month in advance to get the cheaper entry tickets without an organised tour. FEZ, MOROCCO // New article from We Are Travel Girls Senior Contributor Charlotte @luluescapes sharing the 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Fez ⠀
______⠀
⠀
"I’d been wanting to visit Fez for a long time now and finally went in November for a long weekend with a girlfriend. It’s the perfect time frame to visit Fez, but if you want to also go to Chefchaouen (4 hours away) then I’d suggest adding another day or two.
⠀
The medina of Fez has a remarkable history dating back to the late 8th century and you can really feel this when you wander around the narrow streets. When in Fez, you have to keep your eyes open all the time because there are beautiful spots everywhere that are perfect for Instagram!"⠀
⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com by WATG Contributor Pippa Marffy @wander_pip 'The Seven Sisters Coastal Day - Escape from London you need to do'

______
Just an hour or two from London, you’ll find an abundance of activities that’ll make you love London even more, one of these places is Seven Sisters. This is the name given to the magnificent series of white chalk cliffs that line the coast of the Sussex South Downs, directly south of London. With grass as pristine as the green on a golf course and endless sea views, this is a walk that must be on your to-do list.

LAKE LOUISE, ALBERTA // A real winter wonderland brought to you by Whitney @blonde_atlas⠀
______⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Whitney ↠ Lake Louise is known for its piercing, glacial blue water that you so often see in photos, but don’t expect to see that year round! Starting around November, The lake freezes and the landscape quickly transforms into a winter wonderland (and the lake usually doesn’t thaw until June!) It’s a completely different experience depending on the time of the year you visit, but I for one LOVED how magical everything looked covered in a blanket of snow (plus I’m told there are far less tourists in the winter!) But no matter what kind of season you prefer, it’s safe to say that Lake Louise is breathtaking year round.⠀
______⠀
⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today by WATG Contributor Kelsey Madison @kelseylynnmadison 'Wonderfruit Festival Survival Guide: This Years Must Go To Festival'
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Held every December, Wonderfruit is a four-day festival of art, music and sustainable living in the coastal town of Pattaya, Thailand. It is a relatively new festival, this being only its third year running, but if you are traveling to Thailand it is one that should 100% be on your bucket list! So, how do you navigate this beautiful sensory overload? In Kelsey's first post for WATG she tells you exactly how! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

New post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today from WATG Contributor Zanna @ZannavanDijk 'A Life Changing Experience in Sierra Leone'
•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••
In May this year, Zanna embarked on a journey to Sierra Leone with the charity Street Child @streetchildsl to participate in a charity marathon and spend seven days with the communities in the region. Zanna tells the story of how she got involved with the charity, her experiences in Sierra Leone, the struggles that local Sierra Leoneans face and importantly the lessons she took away from the experience. This is truly an informative read and we hope you take the time to read and share it!
PS. Yes we are related! Incredibly proud to count Zanna as one of my (many) cousins! •••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

ICELAND // A spectacular view at Goðafoss enjoyed by travel girl Khanh @khanh_iyuiyu⠀
______⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Khanh ↠ The Goðafoss is a gigantic waterfall in Bárðardalur - Iceland. No wonder it is also called the waterfall of gods. You can reach it at the beginning Sprengisandur highland road. The water falls from a height of 12 meters over a width of 30 meters. Most of the time it’s going to be a windy, cold and tourist driven place. But if you are not afraid of getting wet and are willing to climb up the stones, you will be rewarded with a breathtaking experience away from all the bustle and hustle.⠀
______⠀
⠀

Traveller Tip ↠ Cape Kidnappers is on the east coast of New Zealand’s North island in sunny Hawkes Bay. It is home to miles of dramatic white cliffs as well as the worlds largest and most accessible gannet colony. Also near Cape Kidnappers is a world famous golf course that has unbeatable views past the cliffs and out to sea. A top Hawkes Bay spot!⠀

Cape Reinga, New Zealand. Feeling free at the tip of NZ Photo by Leah @freeandaddicted @lelahbell ⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Cape Reinga is at the very tip of Aotearoa (New Zealand). Making the trip is an absolute must with the rugged NZ landscape and views as far as the eye can see. On a good day you can even see where the Tasman Sea and the Pacific Ocean smash into each other. Make sure you walk down the trail and right out to the lighthouse, this walk is a great place for photos and has incredible 360degreee views. Please note the walk is not flat, do expect a bit of a climb each way but my 86 year old nana did it, so you can too 😊⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today by WATG Contributor Lisanne van Beurden of @chaptertravel '5 Fun and Free Things To Do In Kyoto'
_____
Kyoto is one of those destinations you don’t dare to miss if you’re in Japan. In this beautiful city you can find modern trends mixed together with rich culture and heritage. Even though it’s one of the most popular cities in Japan, the mystique around Kyoto remains. There are so many iconic temples, forests, imperial palaces and traditional houses to explore. Unfortunately, most places in Japan are quite expensive. Especially Kyoto can really make you dig deep into your pockets. Luckily, there are enough fun things to do that don’t cost a dime. In this article we list six free fun things to do in Kyoto!

Palace of Monserrate, Sintra. Photo by Marina @marinademar⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Not very far from the historic centre of Sintra is one of the most beautiful architectural and landscape Romantic creations in Portugal: the Park and Palace of Monserrate, unique representatives of 19th century eclecticism. The Palace combines gothic and Indian influences as well as Moorish suggestions together with exotic and plant motifs which are harmoniously extended to the exterior. The gardens have received species from all corners of the world, which were planted according to their geographical origin. The front lawn of the Palace provides a well-deserved rest, while discovering one of the richest Portuguese botanical gardens.⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀

Inverted Portal at Tippet Rise Art Center. Photo by Caroline Joan @carolinejoan⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Perhaps still a best-kept secret, Tipper Rise Art Center in southeastern Montana is an 11,000 acre ranch that is home to nine incredible sculptures by artists and architects from around the world. The whole space in time is seamless in its power: the earth, the structures, the mountains, the sky, the rising sun, bound by the ever-present and unifying wind. Admission to explore this overwhelming space is free, but the summer-only season fill quickly! Make your reservations early ~ you won't regret it.⠀
⠀

Ladies We Love is a monthly interview series with women from around the world that provide us with inspiration through their travels and personal stories. This month we got to know travel writer Kristin Addis of Be My Travel Muse @bemytravelmuse⠀⠀
______⠀⠀
⠀⠀
An investment banker turned travel writer, Kristin Addis has been traveling the globe nonstop since 2012 documenting her adventures on her popular blog Be My Travel Muse. Kristin has traveled the world mostly alone, hitchhiking on every continent except for Antarctica (including over 2k miles in China), disappearing into the wilderness on week-long treks in Alaska and Kyrgyzstan, and traveling solo in South Africa and Mozambique – and hitchhiking there too. She recently also authored the popular book, Conquering Mountains, How To Solo Travel The World Fearlessly, with the intention of encouraging women to travel solo.⠀⠀
⠀⠀

MILAN, ITALY // Nicole Trujillo @btnicole taking in the views at the Duomo di Milano.⠀
✧✧✧✧✧
⠀
Traveller Tip From Nicole ↠ For a long time, Italy felt like a distant dream - a place I might never reach. I think it's safe to say that my soul-searching trip to Milan has been much needed. I'm living, I'm learning, and I'm loving. This place isn't just of history and tradition, it's also a country that's striving to be up to date, while not forgetting about its ancient roots. The city is filled with many lovers of poets, dramatists, and painters. If you are a coffee lover like me, you will enjoy the cafes that are located in every corner! Visit the rooftop of Duomo Cathedral where the view brings you directly into a 19th century oil painting.⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today by WATG Contributors Alyssa Gunn & Hannah Moloney of @theodysea 'Dominican Republic: The Beat Backpacking Hotspot In The Caribbean'
--------------------------------------------------
Sharing their third story whilst backpacking together, Alyssa and Hannah give you the rundown on the Dominican Republic and how you can travel there on a budget! We are accepting guest contributors to write for our site and we want you to be one of them! In case you didn't already know, we publish informative travel stories 5 days a week from our community of women across the globe. ⠀⠀

WHY WRITE FOR US? ⠀⠀
⠀⠀
We just wrapped up our first retreats in Bali @travelgirlsgetaways, where we featured a series a boutique blogger workshops, covering building your brand, mastering your blog, growing your social media presence, getting press and PR, working with brands and so much more. One thing we taught the girls is that guest writing is a huge element of growing your brand and here are a few reasons why writing for WeAreTravelGirls.com will help you: ⠀⠀
⠀⠀
- Your article will be shared with our followers across all of our social platforms reaching over 375,000 followers!⠀⠀
- Your article will go out to all of our email subscribers.⠀⠀
- If you know anything about SEO, then you know that back links to your site are key! Your website / blog will be linked in the article. (You can even link related articles from your blog.)⠀⠀
- All of your social links will be shared in the author bio directing new followers to your channels.⠀⠀
- An opportunity to reach a new audience of female travellers.⠀⠀
- An example of published work that you can share on your press page and with other publications if you plan to write freelance. ⠀⠀
- The opportunity to become a senior contributor, with perks such as attending press trips on behalf of We Are Travel Girls!⠀⠀
- Become part of an awesome community of women who have written for us before!⠀⠀
⠀⠀
So what are you waiting for? Join over 200 women in the We Are Travel Girls community who have written for us and submit your article today! Head to WeAreTravelGirls.com/Contribute, link in our bio. ⠀⠀

BURANO, ITALY // Ciara @hey_ciara lost in colourful Burano
______⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Ciara ↠ I didn’t know a place like Burano existed. This is the most colorful town I’ve ever seen, possibly in the whole world. This wasn’t just a row of homes, the whole neighborhood was painted a vibrant color. Every home. Every color. It was a weird journey getting to Burano. I’d only had 2 hours of sleep on a bus the night before. I landed in Florence at nearly midnight then took a bus to Venice. I needed to be at the bus stop at a certain time & only taxis were available so I was overcharged $40 for a 20 min ride. I made it to the bus stop & another girl asked me a question. I’d already identified that we’d stick together if anything went down. I didn’t realize that this bus wasn’t direct, so we had a stop at about 2am-5am. ⠀
⠀
We sat at a sketchy bus stop with our bags before our second bus came. She didn’t speak much English, but I was happy to still be together. We arrived in town at a foggy 6am & had to walk around for an hour with our bags before storing them at a hostel for the day. We decided to spend the day together since we were both solo. ⠀
⠀
First we stopped at a cafe to grab coffee, then wandered through the canals of Venice. We both wanted to go to Burano, so we bought a ticket and arrived midday to explore the colorful town. At the end of the day, when @merveeuls (the girl I️ met! She’s Turkish) said “I’m really glad I met you”, my heart melted! I told her I was really glad to meet her & spend the day with her too! How's that for girls sticking together around the world!? I’ve had some of the best experiences with other solo female travelers I’ve met around the world! I️ get a lot of messages from you about being nervous about solo travel, but there are quite a few of us out there & I’m sure we can all agree that somehow things just come together!⠀
______⠀
⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today by WATG Contributor Sarah Latham @_sarahlatham '3 Days In Cairns, Australia'
----------------------------------------------
Cairns is a tourist hub, but don’t let that put you off, sometimes it’s not always the ‘path less travelled’ that makes all the difference – if two million people from all across the globe visit this region each year they are probably onto a good thing! In Sarah's posts she shares what to see in Cairns and the surrounding area, from waterfalls, to tea plantations, beautiful gorges to epic views! Read it today on WeAreTravelGirls.com

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today from WATG Contributor Julie Disch @theworldandjuless 'Adventuring Through The Cays, The Exumas'
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
The Exumas are are a chain of 365 cays (think islands) that are considered Bahamas’ territory. It’s the perfect destination for island hopping, relaxing, diving and most importantly, adventuring. In Julie's second post for We Are Travel Girls she shares her tops tips for enjoying this incredible part of the world.

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today from WATG Co-Founder Vanessa of @VanessaRivers 'Czeching Into The Mandarin Oriental, Prague'
•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••
Built on the site of a former 14th century monastery, Mandarin Oriental, Prague has managed to beautifully preserve a piece of the city’s history and heritage while offering guests a five-star luxury experience.

We Are Travel Girls Friday Favourites // Every Friday Founders @beckyvandijk and @vanessarivers share some of our favourite travel destinations, activities, travel products and travel tips with you!⠀
________

This week our Friday Favourite is Channel Islands Surfboards @cisurfboards 🏄 I grew up on the Central Coast of Calfiornia and always loved the ocean. When I started college at UC Santa Barbara I fell in love with surfing. Surfing led me around the world in search of sun, sand and surf, usually with my favorite CI board by my side. But no matter where I travel to, Rincon in Santa Barbara will always be my favorite surf break, and CI Boards will always be my favorite surfboards. Al Merrick makes the best surfboards in the world in my opinion, and I always feel like I have a little piece of home with me on my adventure when I have my CI board 🏄🏽‍♀️@vanessarivers
______

Our page may be a great place to find travel inspiration from women around the world, but are you also interested in connecting with them offline and meeting up to explore new destinations? I recently left London to travel in Indonesia, and whilst I am travelling with my partner I do miss my girlfriends back home! 👭
So, I recently found @bungeegirl, the perfect app for finding and meeting other girls who are on the road! It's free to download and super simple to use. You add a little information about yourself, plus a few of your favourite travel snaps and you are ready to start searching for travel companions by specific location! Happy travelling ladies! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today by WATG Contributor France @iamfsc 'A Guide To Road Tripping Around New Zealand's North Island'
--------------------------------------------------
"Growing up with plenty of road trip vacations, it’s no secret that I love them! It gives you a chance to explore a large distance of area with your own itinerary and best of all, you can stop whenever and wherever you want. I jumped at the chance of taking a road trip around the North Island of New Zealand during my visit in December. It was my winter, their summer - the ideal time to go."

LANDMANNALAUGAR, ICELAND // "You wouldn't believe Iceland's endless lava fields spanning across the country," captured by Connie Cao @kisforkani⠀
______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // Landmannalaugar, located in Fjallabak Nature Reserve in the Highlands of Iceland, can be found behind an expanse of dried lava originally formed in 1477. Known for its epic and stunning hikes, expect to spend the good part of a day here - not that you'll ever want to leave!⠀

There are several theories to why the city of Chefchaouan is painted blue, to ward of mosquitos or introduced by Jews that took refuge here in the 1930's. But we like that the blue is to symbolise the sky and heaven and to serve as a reminder to lead a spiritual life. Whatever the origins Chechaouan looks to be a truly magical place and we love this shot from Anna @annanymity exploring it, follow her page to see the rest of her adventures!

Kuang Si Falls, Laos. Photo by Ellie Green @thegingerwanderlust⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Kuang Si falls in Laos are, hands down, THE most beautiful waterfalls I have ever seen! This is no instagram trick the water is really that turquoise! and even better - you can SWIM here! The waterfalls are busiest from 10am to 4pm so try to come before or after then (it's open from 8am to 5pm). There are 6 "pools", 4 of which you can swim in, the one in the picture you can't swim in so no matter what time of day you go you can get a good pic here! You can easily get here from Luang Prabang, it's about an hour drive by tuk tuk, minivan or scooter.⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀

Is it spring yet?! Looking back at this photo from a beautiful sunny day in London and missing the city! Photo of me, @beckyvandijk and @vanessarivers⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Having lived in Notting Hill for several years I have loads of tips for visiting this beautiful part of London! But I know that most visitors want to make their way straight to Portobello Road to find the colourful houses - so I will share my tip for finding the best streets away from the crowds! Instead of following the tourists as you leave the underground, get your Google map out and head in the opposite direction to Hillgate Place and Farm Place where you will find a lot more of these colourful houses and be able to explore the area without any crowds. Plus, there are also a few great pubs in this area to take a break from your sightseeing for lunch!⠀
⠀

THE BLUE LAGOON, ICELAND // The perfect place to spend the afternoon after Christmas by Stephanie @s_mok02⠀
______⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Stephanie ↠ The Blue Lagoon is a Geothermal spa that features three active ingredients: Silica, Algae and Minerals. The water temperature is 37-40 °C (98-104°F), year round and looks milky white color, however the sun simply makes it look aqua blue. When visiting the Blue Lagoon, it is worthwhile to pre-book tickets that way you avoid the long line-ups. The most popular package is the premium option which includes a bathrobe, towel, slippers, mud masks and one free drink – This is once in a life time experience, so make the splurge!⠀
______⠀
⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today by WATG Contributor Amanda Ulmer @2bluepassports 'The Ultimate Road Trip: Driving The Road To Hana, Hawaii'
----------------------------------------------------
''Nothing exemplifies the phrase, “Life is a journey, not a destination,” quite like a road trip. For the ultimate one, head to Maui, Hawaii and drive the Road to Hana. You’ll explore a lush bamboo forest, soak up the sun at a black sand beach, hike to gorgeous views, and swim in the pools of cascading waterfalls. So pack a swimsuit, sneakers, and a change of clothes, grab some friends, and follow along as I show you the 10 best stops to make along the Road to Hana!''

ABU DHABI // A visit to Abu Dhabi should include a stop at the stunning Emirate Palace hotel captured by @marthamanz ⠀
______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // There are many landmark buildings across the world. In terms of construction costs, Emirates Palace takes the fourth position being one of the most expensive hotels ever built. The design represents traditional Arabian elements like domes, and most of the suites are decorated in marble and gold. Thats why when visiting Abu Dhabi, you should visit, they don't ask for any reservation and you are totally free to enter and wander around this spectacular building. Also you will get a perfect view of the iconic Etihad Tower from there.⠀
⠀

⠀

Chefchaouen, Morocco. Photo by Michelle Halperne @livelikeitsthewknd with Hannah @hannahrheaume⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Exploring Chefchaouen, Morocco is like getting lost in the most beautiful labyrinth where there's always little treasures to be found along the way. The tricky part is, there aren't many big landmarks to go off of, so you kind of have to navigate and stumble upon places on your own -- although asking a local always helps. This spot in Chefchaouen adorned with colorful flower pots is probably one of the most popular photo spots in the blue-washed town, which is why when we were here mid-day there were large tour groups strolling through all stopping for photos. To avoid this chaos, definitely wake up on the earlier side! It's hard to say exactly where this spot is, but it's off a pretty heavily trafficked cobblestone walk street up the hill from the main medina -- if you search hard enough, you're sure to find it!⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀

STAVANGER, NORWAY // A fairytale town in Norway captured by Jiayi Wang @thediaryofanomad⠀
______⠀⠀
⠀⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // This quaint little city is home to an old town decorated with cobblestones and white houses that look straight out of a fairytale. These houses harbour quite an interesting past too. Back in the days, they symbolised wealth as white paint was imported and hence more expensive, not to mention that it was even pricier to keep it clean in the salty sea air. Sometimes, people would paint the front of their house white to show their neighbours they could afford it, while the rest of the house would be a different colour. If you make your way here, don't forget to hike Preikestolen during sunrise as well!⠀⠀

We Are Travel Girls Friday Favourites // Every Friday Founders @beckyvandijk and @vanessarivers share some of our favourite travel destinations, activities, travel products and travel tips with you!⠀
________

This week our Friday Favourite is the area of Kampot and Kep in Cambodia. I visited Kampot earlier this year and absolutely loved this lesser visited part of Cambodia. This shot was taken in Bokor National Park, a great day trip from Kampot where you can explore a derelict casino, Buddhist temples, old Catholic Churches, waterfalls and see some beautiful views as the clouds roll in!
The trip was my second time in Cambodia, my first was 14 years ago before there were thousands of people at Angkor Wat and Siem Reap, so I was excited to find an area with less crowds and highly recommend heading here if you visit Cambodia 🇰🇭@beckyvandijk

This weeks Friday Favorite is @cocobelledesigns. Cocobelle was founded in 2004 by Lucy Peglar and Ignacio Bussy. A love of travel and the ocean inspired the pair to create a sandal and accessory collection that is today produced in both Bali and Italy, embracing authentic Balinese-inspired patterns and centuries-old Italian artistry. Cocobelle describe their collections as "refined, beautiful, wild, comfortable and timeless."⠀

Each guest on our retreat was gifted one of these gorgeous Pom Pom Beach Bags as part of their retreat gift bag which was the perfect companion on all of our day trips around the island.⠀
