LOCOROTONDO, ITALY // Marika @marikamarangella enjoying the festive season in Puglia⠀
______⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Marika ↠ Locorotondo is one of Italy's most beautiful towns. It's located in the Itria Valley, a magic area of the Puglia, in the South of Italy. This town, but also the all area is well know because of the Trulli, a typical Apulian building recently insert in a Disney cartoon called Trulli Tales. In the Itria Valley during the summer you can enjoy your stay relaxing in a Masseria or you can dance till the morning lights in some electronic festival. How to arrive to Locorotondo: take a flight to Bari and then you can be sure that our food, places and culture will make you fall in love with Puglia.⠀

In the Light of Antelope Canyon. Photo by Alexandra @thewayfaress⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Antelope Canyon is a stunning slot canyon located in northern Arizona on Navajo land. Its iconic, wavy canyon walls have been formed from millions of years of erosion, winds, and flooding, and have made it one of the most photographed slot canyons in the world. Visiting in the summer months will give you the sharp beams of sunlight, while winter months will be equally beautiful but with softer colors and lighting. Be sure to make a reservation well in advance for prime time of the day, because spots fill up quickly and the Canyon is only accessible by guided tour!⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com by WATG Contributor Anna Tvrz of @takeeachdaystories | Exploring Cafayate, Northern Argentina⠀⠀
______⠀⠀
"When Argentinian’s want to see a different side of their own country, they head north to the Salta Province. This is a land of contrasts, with towering red rock formations and lush green valleys that are home to the world’s highest altitude vineyards. The pretty town of Cafayate makes an excellent base for exploring what the area has to offer. It’s the perfect place to sample the Salta Province’s iconic empanadas and immerse yourself in the cultural traditions that have inspired generations of musicians and poets."⠀⠀
⠀⠀
Read more on WeAreTravelGirls.com! ⠀⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com by WATG Contributor Roberta de Beni @realdreamsbeliever 'A LUXURY CRUISE IN HA LONG BAY, VIETNAM'

______

Enchanted Ha Long Bay stretches from the northern coastline of Vietnam into the Gulf of Tonkin. “Enchanted” really is the right adjective to describe this wonderful place. It is no wonder in 1994 Ha Long Bay was designated a World Heritage Site. Whether you admire the bay gorgeous landscape from a panoramic spot on the mainland or from the deck of a cruise ship, I can assure you that it’ll be an unforgettable experience.
Read more on WeAreTravelGirls.com!

LAC BLANC, CHAMONIX // The magestic Lac blanc captured by Faten Hamouda @faten09⠀
⠀
______⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Faten ↠ Le Lac Blanc is a beautiful and pristine lake located close to Chamonix (France). From Argentières it is a 4 hours hike that is absolutely worth it. When you get to the lake, you are rewarded by splendid views of the majestic mountains across the valley and intrigued alpine ibexes. The best part is that you can overnight at the refuge on the lakeshore, which will enable you to witness magical lights at sunrise and sunset (do not forget to check if it is open beforehand!).⠀

BERCHTESGADEN, GERMANY // Travel girl Chanel @howfarfromhome exploring magical ice caves in Germany⠀
______⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Chanel ↠ There are two ice caves in the Berchtesgaden German Alps that you can reach in the Summertime (don't go in Winter...trust us, we tried and knee-deep hiking near avalanches isn't advised, especially as the ice caves are covered in snow). You'll catch a boat across the Königssee, and get off at the St. Bartholomew church, and after an hour hike you'll reach the caves. If you're planning to photograph them inside, make sure you bring a raincoat or poncho and cover for your camera as it certainly gets wet in there!⠀

______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // Taking the train in Sri Lanka, is a great and inexpensive way to get around. The train journeys are a cultural experience in themselves and the most scenic routes will turn out to be some of the highlights of your trip. In particular the journey from Colombo to Kandy and up into Tea Country and the coastal train ride from Colombo to Dutch colonial Galle. Plus you get to take incredible photos like this on route!⠀

LITTLE INDIA, SINGAPORE // One of the most colourful parts of Singapore explored by Liselore @grabyourbagsnl⠀ ✧✧✧✧✧
⠀
Traveller Tip From Liselore ↠ So you thought Singapore was all about futuristic skyscrapers and fancy buildings? Well it is, but there is more. Personally I am more into the ‘typical’ chaotic SouthEast Asian cities full of scooters, shouting street vendors and with amazing food stalls at every corner of the street, but then there is Little India. A surprisingly colourful and vibrant neighbourhood and -as you can imagine- my favourite part of town. Of course the colourful houses are amazing, but especially if you're traveling on a budget you should to Tekka Centre. Here you'll find countless food stalls with Indian food, it was the best I've ever had!⠀
⠀

Paradise in Glenorchy, New Zealand. Photo by Zemira Semmal @thelittlebrave⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ This famous Lord of the Rings spot called Glenorchy is located 45 minutes from Queenstown. The road to ‚GY’ is all about sweeping bends with the road stretching for miles ahead of you, curling up the hillside with the crystaline blue of Lake Wakatipu spread out below and mountains magestic around the far side of the lake. You‘ll find yourself questioning if it's real, if anything could be this perfect - it is. Instagram worthy moments can be captured at the Glenorchy wharf & all around the Glenorchy walk as well as visiting Paradise, horse trekking and several tramping tracks.⠀
⠀

Beauty in every corner of Antiparos. Photo by Yawilka Mayer @iwasinspired⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Definitely a highlight of my three week stay in Greece. I took a bus from Parikia to Pounda and then a ferry to Antiparos. I fell in love with the cute cafes and traditional houses with beautiful bougainvilleas dangling from the rooftops. After exploring the town, I decided to visit the Cave of Antiparos. The Cave has the oldest stalagmite in Europe, which is 45 million years old. Don’t miss this island if you are in the Cyclades.⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀

GOSAUSEE // Winter dreaming with Verena @topolindra⠀
______⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Verena ↠ We’ve seen so many beautiful pictures of the Gosausee upfront but seeing the lake transformed into the picture perfect Winterwonderland just blew our mind! Gosau is located in the charming area of Salzkammergut in Austria, which is famous for its amazing mountain landscape and picturesque lakes. In Gosau you can actually find two lakes, located next to each other and only a 1,5 hour hike apart. As there was so much snow we were not able to see the second lake as the ways were blocked with amounts of snow. We cannot wait to come back and visit this amazing location in spring or summer!⠀

MIRACLE GARDENS, DUBAI // Tag your travel bestie who you would like to visit this spot with! Adorable capture from Jenny @jetset_jen with Siobhan @they.wanderlust⠀
______⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Jenny ↠ The Dubai Miracle Garden is the largest natural flower garden in the world with around 100 million beautiful blooms. The Alice In Wonderland-style park is only open during the winter months from November until May and it's best to arrive when the gates open at 9am to beat the crowds. Stop by the butterfly garden next door on your way home.

MAMMOTH LAKES // Sunset sessions in hot springs with your friends has to be the best way to spend a winter evening. Tag your travel besties who you want to be here with this holiday season! Thanks to Nicole Lam @donutworry___ for sharing this stunning photo taken with her girlfriends @anvynator and @wzylouisey⠀
______⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Nicole ↠ Mammoth Lakes, California is known for one of the best ski resorts in this country. What most people don’t know is that just 10-15 minute outside of town, there are a ton of natural hot springs that are heavenly to soak in! Whether you’ve spent all day on the slopes during the winter season or hiking/backpacking during the summer season, these hot springs are a must! The best time of the day to be soaking in these hot springs are either early mornings before sunrise or early evenings just right before the sun sets. But really, there are no bad hours to be here. Some hot springs out here may require a 4x4 car with high clearance, but most are easy to get to. Not to mention, there are no bad views for any of these hot springs as they are surrounded by the views of the eastern sierra, which are beyond amazing.⠀

We Are Travel Girls Friday Favourites // Every Friday Founders @beckyvandijk and @vanessarivers share some of our favourite travel destinations, activities, travel products and travel tips with you!
______
This weeks Friday Favourite is a destination tip and a great travel product. If you are heading to London and want to get your photo with the colourful houses in Notting Hill, head in the opposite direction to the crowds when you leave the tube. Instead of going to Portabello Rd, head to Hillgate Place, where you will find no crowds, plenty of pastel houses and a few cute pubs to stop at! Travel win!
The second Friday Favourite is @loandsons, our absolute fave travel bag company! The bags have been cleverly designed by a mother and her sons to solve her own travel needs. Each design is well thought out with useful pockets for passports, Kindles, keys and padded to protect your valuables. This gorgeous bag is The Claremont, which is actually a stylish SLR camera bag that I don't ever leave home without! 📷 by Serena @serenahoud
______

HANOI, VIETNAM // Aren’t you glad places like this exist?! Beautiful capture by Kelsey @milesofsmiles._⠀
______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // The hustle and bustle of Hanoi gives tourists a plethora of things to do and see, one thing you should add to your list is visiting the Imperial Citadel of Thăng Long, a UNESCO world Heritage Site. With an entrance fee of only 30.000 dong ($1.50 USD), this is an inexpensive way to see the history and culture of Vietnam through gardens, ancient palaces and roads, and French influenced architecture. ⠀

ALPSTEIN, SWITZERLAND // Sabrina @moonhoneytravelers hiking for cheese in Switzerland. ⠀
______⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Sabrina ↠ Do you love cheese? Do you love to hike? If yes, Appenzellerland might be your heaven. This north-eastern Swiss region produces a nutty, bold cheese called Appenzeller Käse. To taste the best regional cheese, you need to hike into the mountains. For breathtaking scenery, hike to Seealpsee (a beautiful lake) in the Alpstein mountain range. The trail meanders through dairy farms and mountain inns. For the best view, head to the cliff-side restaurant Äscher. You can buy cheese directly from the dairy farms, or you can order a generous slab at Äscher. Alternatively, you can hike to Fählensee and eat at the mountain inn Bollenwees. They serve the best cheese Rösti (hash browns).⠀

'I think the world—especially the western one—forgot what Beauty really is. Quest For Beauty is an actual quest around the globe to rediscover the meaning of this magical world. A Journey that, through different cultures, will hopefully remind us to find acceptance and pride in the way we look and to love ourselves for who we are. Our uniqueness is, in my opinion, the best asset we have and there's nothing more beautiful than being our beautifully unique selves!' - Sara Melotti
Here at We Are Travel Girls we are super excited to be partnering with @saramelotti_ , the woman behind @questforbeauty.co to share her story. Sara is undertaking an inspiring project that will take her across the globe to show that beauty is in every woman, of any size, culture or skin colour.
You can read about Sara's project on her site www.questforbeauty.co and see her stunning photography on @questforbeauty.co and @saramelotti_ .

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today by Contributor Sabrina Braber @worldofaccomodation 'Why You Will Love Nayara Springs, Costa Rica'
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Costa Rica is known for it’s lush tropical rainforests, volcanoes, wildlife and vast range of adventure activities. A trip to this country offers so much, that it’s hard to decide where to start, or where to stay! If you are looking for a beautiful retreat, offering a tranquil place to relax after some volcano treks and white water rafting, then Sabrina shows you should consider Nayara Springs.

Meet Alexandra Saper @thewayfaress, a lawyer from Washington DC who recently launched her travel blog. You may have already seen that over the next few weeks we are introducing you to the women who joined our first retreats in Bali, sharing who they are and why they joined the trip so that you can connect with them and see if you will find your tribe at a future @travelgirlsgetaways! ⠀⠀⠀⠀
______⠀⠀
⠀⠀
We asked Alexandra why she joined the trip and what she took away from the experience, "I joined the Bali retreat because the WATG newsletter announcing the trip landed in my inbox within just a week or so of deciding to get serious about my travel blog. I've been dying to see Bali, and to do it in an educational context, surrounded by like-minded women, while learning the nitty-gritty of how to run a blogging business from some of my favorite travel lady bosses, sounded like the best way (and perfect timing) to explore this beautiful island on the other side of the world!⠀⠀
⠀⠀
I took so much more from the retreat than just a fun trip to Bali (which, of course, it was). I made lifelong friends and travel buddies, learned so much not just from the workshops, but also informally from the other women on the retreat, and left feeling equipped, empowered, and excited to start digging into the next steps in growing my blog. I'm looking forward to stepping into 2018 with the tools to develop and advance my blogging business, and certainly with another WATG retreat on the horizon! Maybe all of them?? 😆”
⠀⠀
Follow Alexandra's adventures on her blog TheWayfaress.com⠀⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today by WATG Contributor Tessa Torrente @travel_wheretonext 'How To Visit Jeju-Do Island, Korea On A Budget' ----------------------------------------------
''First off, if you don’t know anything about Jeju-do Island it’s totally OK. I didn’t know a single thing about it before landing in Korea. Jeju-do is the largest island off the coast of the Korean Peninsula, known for its beach resorts and volcanic landscape of craters and cave like lava tubes. Jeju-do (or simply Jeju) is also on the New 7 Wonders Of Nature list, and is even called ‘the Hawaii of Korea,’ making it a hot honeymoon destination spot.''

CASABLANCA, MORROCO // How beautiful is this architecture? Stunning shot by Abena @beautifully.flawed.one ⠀
______⠀
⠀
TRAVELLER TIP // Hassan II Mosque, one of the largest moques in the world, serves as the main mosque in Casablanca, Morocco, a port city and commercial hub in western Morocco. The mosque is know its beauty and grandness, appropriate descriptions for a building commissioned by a king. In 1980 King Hassan II commissioned the mosque to create a single landmark monument in Casablanca. When visiting this religious site, keep in mind to dress decently and respectfully and, unless you are a Muslim visiting during prayer times, be sure to book a tour!⠀

I get a lot of questions from you asking how you can be featured on We Are Travel Girls. So I thought that over the next few posts I would give you some tips on how to get yourself noticed and featured on this page! So here goes 💕
Feature Tip No. 1 ~

CALIFORNIA // A truly magical moment captured by @trulyzipporah at Anza Borrego State Park. Situated about 2 hrs from San Diego, you can add it to a California road trip itinerary and also enjoy mountainous Cuyamaca Rancho State Park en-route to the park.
_______
Please share your own tips for Californias state parks and your favourite road trip destinations in the comments below!
______

We Are Travel Girls Friday Favourites // Every Friday Founders @beckyvandijk and @vanessarivers share some of our favourite travel destinations, activities, travel products and travel tips with you!
______
This weeks Friday Favourite is the island of Lombok in Indonesia and one of our favourite hotels, Tugu Lombok.
The island is located just a half hour flight from Bali, or a 2hr boat ride and is home to a pink beach, the highest volcano in Indonesia, some of the worlds most unique waterfalls and even natural hot springs to unwind in. If you are headed to Lombok, we recommend staying at the incredible Tugu hotel which is home to the largest collection of Indonesian antiquities in Indonesia, amassed over many years by founder Anhar Setjadibrata. A stay at one of Tugu's hotels is like stepping back in time. And as a bonus you get to spend your days at one of Lombok's most spectacular private beaches! @tuguhotels
______

⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Lake Bled is a SLovenian gem located in the heart of the Alps. There are many picture perfect places to experience Bled, but three of them attract most of the visitors - pier with a statue in a shape of a heart overlooking magnificent lake and the island, the castle view up on the clif and the most majestic, Ojstrica hill view, where this picture was taken. But Bled is not popular only for its beauty, as it is the place where wished come true. The legend says that if you ring a bell in the Mary's church, your vish will come true. So, what are you waiting for?⠀

Sintra, Portugal // A Fairytale Palace in the Mountains captured by Jiayi Wang @thediaryofanomad⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Jiayi ↠ The colourful Pena Palace in Sintra is a must-see in Portugal, but if you want to make it even more unforgettable - get up early and be the first one in when the gates open so that you can have this beauty all to yourself for a few magical minutes. Sintra has many other gems to offer as well, from the mystical gardens of Quinta da Regaleira to the exotic Monserrate Palace. People often recommend it as a day trip from Lisbon, but having done that and having gone back the following day, I'd say stay overnight and give this spectacular town the time it truly deserves!⠀

Cute Little Penguins at Boulders Beach! Photo by Cindy Arreguin @cindyycheeks⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ Boulders Beach is located in the Cape Peninsula of South Africa. There, you’ll find thousands of African penguins wandering freely. You can observe them at close range and you can even swim with them. The penguins are so cute and adorable, but if they feel threatened they will bite. So, be careful! Also, these penguins are an endangered species, which is why they reside in a protected natural environment. If you visit, please be respectful and kind to these little guys. 🐧💕⠀

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com by WATG Co-Founder Vanessa Rivers @vanessarivers '7 Reasons To Visit Szczecin, Poland'⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
“Szczecin (shcheh-cheen) is a charming, port city located on the Oder River, one hour’s drive from the Baltic Sea, in Northwest Poland. It’s known for its 19th-century Chobry Embankment, the St. James Cathedral with a 14th-century triptych, stained-glass windows and a tower with sweeping city views, and the renovated Pomeranian Dukes’ Castle, which is now a cultural center. Szczecin’s population is a little over 400,000, surprisingly making it one of the largest cities in Poland. The streets of the old town, and the city center are calm and quite, but at its water’s edge Szczecin is a busy port city offering much to do and see!”⠀
⠀

ATHABASCA GLACIER // ''To know what life is worth you have to risk it once in awhile.
On this adventure I went beyond my limits and risked my life for this experience. It was my first time experiencing a whole new element. Was it worth it? Absolutely! The Glaciers are closed for the winter due to unpredictable weather. But for me a locked gate was an invitation.
I don't recommend this hike to anyone without a guide. It was a thrilling yet terrifying experience. Each step felt like I was near death. I fell twice on black ice and ended up near a sinkhole. The snow was deceiving as it seemed like it was just snow later we realized we were standing on top of a thin layer of frozen river. You can hear the river roaring right underneath us. My heart was pounding, I was imagining the worse.
At this point my feet and hands were beyond frozen I was doubting my movement but we carefully made our way out of this situation and continued hiking towards the glaciers. The wind felt like tiny sharp knives stabbing our face at 100mph. We couldn't see 5 feet in front of us. We eventually made our way through the storm. Finally, we climbed the side of the glacier and entered through a small hole.
I couldn't believe what I was standing in front of. It felt unreal. There was a moment where I felt no pain and just stood in awe. It was exactly what I had imagined it to be. I'm glad I get to live another day to tell this story, another day to explore this beautiful world. As exciting as this was never attempt to walk on the glaciers yourself. Several deaths have occurred from people falling through hidden crevices and sinkholes that are covered by thin layer of snow.'' Image and words by Catarina @wherescatarina, a woman who is beautiful both inside and out! Follow her for adventurous travels, inspiration and wanderlust! ✈️

NAIROBI // ''After eating my own breakfast, I was able to feed the giraffes theirs. This giraffe was particularly friendly and luckily I was able to get him to stand still enough to get this photo. Spending time at the giraffe manor is once of those experiences in life that is so magical that it's hard to describe and almost feels like a dream. Interacting with these beautiful animals is something that I have longed to do for a while now. It was the number one thing on my bucket list and I have no idea how I will ever be able to top this vacation. For those who want to plan a trip to the Giraffe Manor, I would recommend staying in the newer manor. If you stay there, you'll be able to feed the giraffes from your window in the morning.'' Photo and caption by Travel Girl Bianca Johnson @adventures.of.bianca

SEVILLE, SPAIN // Sibel Baysal @sybilbycall exploring the stunning Plaza de España in Seville.⠀
______⠀
⠀
Traveller Information From Sibel ↠ Plaza de España was built for the Ibero-American Exhibition of 1929 (Expo 29), along with many of the pavilions you can see in and around the Parque Maria Luisa. Plaza de España is a semi-circular brick building, Renaissance/neo-Moorish in style, with a tower at either end (tall enough to be visible around the city, these towers - north and south - are major landmarks). In the front of building there is a big canal. You can rent small boats to row in the canal - the Plaza is known as "the Venice of Seville".⠀
______⠀
⠀

Yesterday I posted to stories about a place in Sri Lanka called Pinnawala. Perhaps you have heard of it, perhaps you have seen your favourite Instagrammer post about it, perhaps you even want to go yourself to get a perfect photo in front of a crowd of elephants. I was so disappointed to see yet another image appear in my feed glamourising Pinnawala I felt I had to say something. ⠀
I had seen this place too before I went to Sri Lanka, but before I visit any destination I do my research and upon reading about the various places to see elephants, I discovered some disturbing truths about Pinnawala. What you don’t see in the pretty pictures are the chains, the bull hooks, the elephant riding, the breeding for captivity and the various other tourist oriented activities here. I didn’t see these for myself because I consciously did not want to visit and support this organisation. But you can read all about it on BornFree.org.uk where they advise tourists not to visit Pinnawala. ⠀
⠀
As a community with a large following, we have a responsibility to help educate others about travelling responsibly and ethically. Please do the same. Research places before you visit and if you see something you don’t agree with please don’t post a pretty picture anyway! And to the bloggers and Instagrammers with large followings, please think carefully about what you share and the impact your influence has when others travel somewhere specifically to recreate your images. ⠀
⠀
I have been overwhelmed with the response we had to the stories and I appreciate everyone who has messaged or shared this on their own page to help spread this important message. We will continue to do our small part to help educate travellers, and if you want to read more about responsible tourism then please visit WeAreTravelGirls.com or if you want to write for us about this topic we accept article submissions too! ⠀
⠀
This photo was taken in Yala National Park, and you can also see elephants in the wild in many other parks in Sri Lanka or at the Elephant Transit Home.⠀
⠀
Together we can use our platforms to help educate each other to travel in ethical and responsible ways!⠀
⠀
THANK YOU! Becky @beckyvandijk
Petra by night captured by the lovely @sarah__jessica . Follow her page for more stunning pics from Petra and her other travels.
Where we would rather be. Mykonos with @breeferrie

Next stop on my Malaysia adventure has been Penang, this city is full of street art and historic buildings, none more famous than Cheong Fatt Tze or The Blue Mansion.
Built in the 1880's by merchant Cheong Fatt Tze, this building blends traditional Chinese architecture with tiles from England and iron works from Scotland, and is quite honestly an Instagrammers dream!
Falling into disrepair after the death of its last male descendent, the building was restored over a period of 8 years in the 1990's so that you can now visit and learn about the history of its original owner and the building itself. A must see in Penang! You can follow my travels through Malaysia on @beckyvandijk 💙

Patagonia, a land of snow-capped mountains, glacial lakes, frosted woodland and iced beauty. LAKE MORAINE, BANFF // Ashley @ashandbrooks finding the best view in Banff! We want to transport to this winter wonderland right away. ⠀
______⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip From Asheley ↠ The best view of the day from Lake Moraine is sunrise, but know you aren't alone in this plan for Banff. A plethora of professional and novice photographers alike claim their ground hours before sunrise to catch this magical moment when the sun caps the tops of the mountains that surround Lake Moraine. If you're determined to make it there for sunrise, get out early, bring warm clothes, and pick your spot to watch the magic unfold. When you leave, take the roads as slow as you're able - there's some awesome view points that have places to pull off the road and take in some beautiful, lesser known views of Banff.⠀

Traveller Tip ↠ Seville was named best city to visit in 2018 by Lonely Planet, and it's easy to see why. Aside from visiting its historic sites and wandering through the charming streets, make sure you also catch a Flamenco Show! The city is famous for its flamenco dancing and many different shows are offered every night. It was a highlight of my visit and left me wanting to sign up for the first flamenco class I could find at home. Definitely a can’t miss in Seville!⠀

New post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today from Founder & Editor Becky @beckyvandijk 'The Prettiest Village in Spain You Don't Know About'
•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••
Have you ever heard of Frigiliana? With Spain ranking as the third most visited country in the world and racking up a hefty 68.1 million visitors in 2015 it's surprising that you can still find a slice of seclusion in this country. But you can!
Voted ‘the prettiest village in Andalucia’ by the Spanish Tourism Authority, this gem is located close to Nerja and should be added to your must-do list for your next visit to Spain. So if you are looking for some destination inspiration, check out the post on our site today. •••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

The Blue Pearl Chefchaouen, Morocco. Photo by Sol Escobar @themomentbehind⠀
⠀
✧✧✧✧✧⠀
⠀
Traveller Tip ↠ The 5-hour bus journey from Fez to Chefchaouen is absolutely worth it, even if slightly nauseating due to winding roads. Make sure you take the CTM bus -it costs 75 dirhams each way (roughly £5) and the busses are quite new! If you can, spend more than just one day in Chaouen, there’s plenty to see! Don’t miss watching the sunset from the Spanish Mosque, it’s a 20 minute climb up the mountain path, but when the blue town lights up with the orange tinge of the sky and the call to prayer comes on, it’s pure magic!⠀

BALI // Catching a tropical sunset with @dewars this afternoon! As some of you may know, I quit my banking job in London to adventure around the world and create this travel company, but I keep coming back to Bali... It's not hard to see why when I get to spend my afternoons relaxing in the pool with a drink and a coconut in hand! 🌴🍹 This is my favourite spot to take a break, reflect and enjoy a good cocktail as the sun sets. All whilst keeping my eyes peeled for snakes. Yes, we have already seen a few big green snakes right in our garden AND they can swim! @beckyvandijk

New Post on WeAreTravelGirls.com today by WATG Co-Founder Vanessa @vanessarivers 'How To Spend 3 Days On The Island Of Mallorca'
--------------------------------------------------
The Spanish island of Mallorca has become well known for its stunning beaches, limestone mountains and popular nightlife in the capital city of Palma. Mallorca is also a quick, two-hour flight from London and most major cities in Europe, making it a popular weekend destination. Check out this post to find out why you should be adding Mallorca to your travel list, and what to see and do when you get there! ---------------------------------------------------
